subject: Re: [junit] Test Suites in HTML output
msgSnippet: ... James, Fully understanding that you re already behind on things you ve wanted to look at, have you looked at the parameterized test case support proposed
messageBody:
James Abley wrote:

> The removal of Composite is interesting. I was using it in my application
> thus, along with a custom runner:
>
> - It is an application for functional testing of multi-channel
> websites; i.e. WML, HTML, XHTML, XHTML MP, etc.
> - For each response which comes back to the client, build up a
> PageTestSuite composed of all the PageTestCase subclasses
> configured for
> that device (user-agent).
> - Run the PageTestSuite.

James,

Fully understanding that you're already behind on things you've wanted
to look at, have you looked at the parameterized test case support
proposed for JUnit 4.0? Would that give you what you need here? Thanks,

David Saff
